definition:
A numerical value or percentage applied to a base analysis to refine the predicted outcomes.

Adjustment factors can be cumulative. You can customize them in your analysis by compensating for variations in company, program, and [[exposure data|CAT Modeling]].

definition: [[uncertainty|CAT Modeling]] associated with the damage and loss estimation should a given event occur.

definition: Identifier used in database implementation for unique identification of a record.
author: admin

definition: A component-based, modular, and extensible platform for building applications.
author: admin

definition: A simple, non-topological vector format for storing the geometric location and attribute information of geographic features.
author: admin

definition: A [[cloud|VSS Product]] application and infrastructure environment that serves a single [[client|VSS Product]].
author: admin

definition: A software licensing model in which access to the software is provided on a subscription basis, with the software being located on external servers rather than on servers located in-house.
author: admin

definition: A source program (parent) associated with a subject program (child).
author: admin

definition: The extent to which the losses at two locations behave similarly due to their spatial proximity.
author: admin

definition: An insurance industry term short for individual location-level (spot) facultative (fac) reinsurance. See [[facultative reinsurance|CAT Modeling]].
author: admin

definition: A database that stores [[vector files|VSS Product]], which are numerical representations of data that capture the semantic meaning of text, images, and other data types.
author: admin

definition: A catalog of events that reflects hurricane risk under average climate conditions.
author: admin

definition: An agreement for federal crop [[insurance|CAT Modeling]] that consists of a set of contracts between the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) and private companies. The contracts identify expense reimbursements and risk-sharing by the government on eligible crops.
author: admin

definition: An integer value that indicates at which event during the year the [[layer terms|CAT Modeling]] are to become effective.
author: admin

definition: Refers to the status of the program or [[layer|CAT Modeling]]. Common status types include: Submitted (default), Authorized, Bound, Cancelled, Quoted, Rejected, and for cat bonds, Investment Status.
author: admin

definition: Series of simulated events based on one or more stochastic models over a period of time. Stochastic catalogs can be used when running a loss analysis.
author: admin

definition: An event whose characteristics are obtained from probability distributions in the [[historical catalog|CAT Modeling]].
author: admin

definition: A tool for estimating probability distributions of potential outcomes by allowing for random variation in one or more inputs over time.
author: admin

definition: A programming language for storing and processing information in a relational database. https://aws.amazon.com/what-is/sql/
author: admin

definition: A type of [[layer|CAT Modeling]] condition that applies to a subset of locations within a policy. Sublimits are often used in high-[[hazard|CAT Modeling]] areas to limit losses for locations that fall within them.
author: admin

definition: The maximum amount that an insurance company [[insurance|CAT Modeling]] company is obligated to cover in the event of a covered loss.
author: admin

definition: A [[reinsurance program|CAT Modeling]] where the reinsurer is responsible for the same size of loss on each risk, regardless of the event or year.
author: admin

definition: Measures the average of all simulated losses from a percentile or [[return period|CAT Modeling]] on the loss distribution through the full "tail" of the loss distribution.
author: admin

definition: The percentage of insurable properties actually insured.
author: admin

definition: A company loss set or an [[exposure set|VSS Product]].
author: admin

definition: A catalog of probabilistic events that assumes that the annual probability of a characteristic earthquake occurring on a fault increases with the time elapsed since the previous such earthquake.
author: admin

definition: Loss of use of a structure over time because due to damage, lack of safety, or lack of access. [[loss of use|CAT Modeling]] is referred to as [[additional living expenses|CAT Modeling]] for residential properties, and [[business interruption|CAT Modeling]] for other properties (including commercial, industrial, and others).
author: admin

definition: A catalog of probabilistic events that assumes that the annual probability of a characteristic earthquake occurring on a fault within a given time period is independent of when the last such earthquake occurred and, therefore, requires only knowledge of the mean recurrence time. Compare with [[time-dependent catalog|CAT Modeling]].
author: admin

definition: The minimum of the [[total replacement value|CAT Modeling]] or the limit minus the [[deductible|CAT Modeling]]. If no [[layer|CAT Modeling]] or policy terms are defined, location values, limits, and deductibles are used.
author: admin

definition: The sum of the replacement values for all coverages.
author: admin

definition: A unique identifier provided by the user when creating a program.
author: admin

definition: Program details.
author: admin

definition: [[coverage|CAT Modeling]] purchased by a primary insurer in which the reinsurer must cover any risk that falls within a specified line, class, or book of business. See also [[facultative reinsurance|CAT Modeling]].
author: admin

definition: Characteristics used to define a [[reinsurance program|CAT Modeling]].
author: admin

definition: The mechanism used to determine when payouts must be made. Triggers define company and industry loss parameters and take into consideration the defined geographic region.
author: admin

definition: A UJF is a user-defined [[adjustment factor|CAT Modeling]] that applies to ceding company program losses.
author: admin

definition: Universal Cession Electronic Data Exchange (UNICEDE) is a globally accepted open data format developed by to standardize insurance [[data|Verisk External]] exchange.
author: admin

definition: A loss file whose content must adhere to 's [[loss file|CAT Modeling]] format guidelines.
author: admin

definition: A control that enables you to specify the order of [[magnitude|CAT Modeling]] at which you want to view monetary figures.
author: admin

definition: A standard for identifying servers, printers, and other resources on a network, allowing a consistent access to these resources across different systems.
author: admin

definition: Refers to uncertainty about the fit or appropriateness of a model or the data it uses.
author: admin

definition: A category which allow you to classify companies and programs using criteria that are meaningful and useful to your specific needs.
author: admin

definition: Files that contain numerical representations of data that capture the semantic meaning of text, images, and other data types. See [[SQLite vector file|VSS Product]]
author: admin

definition: The elevated temperature of the ocean's surface, typically measured in the upper few meters. Warm SSTs are crucial in influencing weather patterns, particularly in the formation and intensification of tropical cyclones, hurricanes, and typhoons. Read more
author: admin

definition: A catalog of events based on elevated sea surface temperatures.
author: admin

definition: Event sets that represent low or very low probability disaster scenarios. See [[realistic disaster scenarios|CAT Modeling]], [[extreme disaster scenarios|CAT Modeling]], and [[warm sea surface temperature catalog|CAT Modeling]].
author: admin
